Accounts¶

You can find explaination about the accounts system.

Accounts¶

Acount module is responsible for all acount related operations. It relys on django.contrib.auth.models.User and an override of some of it’s behaviour.

The module currently supports creation of new user process, logging-in and out

Models¶

class map.accounts.models.UserProfile(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Additional user information

This class is supposed to hold the user details that are not holden in auth.User.

Note

Currently not in use.

Views¶

map.accounts.views.logout(request)[source]¶

loges user out

map.accounts.views.mylogin(request)[source]¶

Login handling method

if the request method is GET then the method will return a rendered login page: accounts/login.html

else (POST request) the method will try login the user. if it succeed (usename and passowrd are correct) it will redirect him to the home page otherwise it will return the login page with error message.

map.accounts.views.profile(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

returns the private profile of the user

map.accounts.views.public(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

returns the public profile of a user

Parameters:name – the user name to return his public profile
map.accounts.views.signup(request, template_name='registration/signup.html', email_template_name='registration/signup_email.html', signup_form=<class 'map.accounts.forms.UserCreationForm'>, token_generator=<django.contrib.auth.tokens.PasswordResetTokenGenerator object at 0x944754c>, post_signup_redirect=None)[source]¶

handles sigup requests.

if the request method is GET the method returns the sigup page. if the request method is POST the method validates the login form, and if it’s valid a confirmation email will be sent to the user and he will be redriected to a page telling him that the process finished.

Parameters:
  • template_name – signup template name.
  • email_template_name – confirmation email template.
  • signup_form – signup form.
  • token_generator – confirmation special token generator.
  • post_signup_redirect – the page to redirect to upon successful process
map.accounts.views.signup_complete(request, template_name='registration/signup_complete.html')[source]¶

signup success page.

the users reach this page if they pressed on a real confirmation link.

map.accounts.views.signup_confirm(request, uidb36=None, token=None, token_generator=<django.contrib.auth.tokens.PasswordResetTokenGenerator object at 0x944754c>, post_signup_redirect=None)[source]¶

handles confirmation links.

checks if the confirmation code provided is real. if so, it activates the user associated with this code and redirect him to the signup complete page if the code isn’t valid the user will get and error page.

map.accounts.views.signup_done(request, template_name='registration/signup_done.html')[source]¶

handles requests after submitting sigup request

map.accounts.views.user_comments(request, name)[source]¶

returns a rendered page with the user comments

Parameters:name – the user name.
map.accounts.views.user_points(request, name)[source]¶

returns a rendered page with the user points

Parameters:name – the user name.

Forms¶

class map.accounts.forms.UserCreationForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.util.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=':', empty_permitted=False, instance=None)[source]¶

New users registeration form.

Used to add new users to the database.

Parameters:
  • username – the desired user name. must be unique.
  • password/password2 – account password. password1 and password2 must be equal.
  • email1/email2 – account email. must be valid email. email11 & email2 must be equal.
